description: A course that explores the development of selected film genres (such as horror, film noir, and
documentary film) from the beginnings of film to the present, assessing the impact of each genre
on the cinema of one or more nations. Students examine how genres have been re-imagined in
different cultures or time periods and how cultural rituals and myths, icons and archetypes, and
hybridization affect the development of genres. Prerequisite: Media Studies 160 or premission of
